name: HD 195019
scenarioDescription:
The HD 195019 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 195019 is a star with 1.21 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.48 times its radius. It is located 122.99 light years away from the solar system.

HD 195019 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 195019 system


HD 195019 b

HD 195019 b was discovered by the Lick Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.14 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 195019 b is 1265.64 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 195019 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 195019, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Lick Observatory.
